sn14.7:1.2: In such sequences, _saṅkappa_ occupies the same place as does _vitakka_ in [mn18:16.1](), and so must be “thought” rather than “intention”. When you see something arousing, you perceive it as such, and start thinking about it. Desire arises, which then gives rise to the search, and it is only then that the intention to get something comes in.
